posts.path: How accessible are links and buttons?.md

frontmatter.title: How accessible are links and buttons?
frontmatter.excerpt: Links and buttons are one of the main basic elements that you’ll find on any website. Yet, a lot of them are not as accessible as we would like. If we don't know how they're interpreted by assistive technologies we’re bound to make some mistakes as developers.

posts.path: Don't skip on the skip link.md

frontmatter.title: Don't skip on the skip link
frontmatter.excerpt: When you search for the definition of a skip link, you’ll often find that it’s described as a mechanism to skip past repeating blocks of content. This might be confusing at first, but it’s actually quite straight forward. I’ll explain what a skip link actually means and how we could implement one.

frontmatter.title: The rules on using ARIA
frontmatter.excerpt: If you never heard of ARIA before, I'll give you a brief introduction on what it does. And after that, we'll cover the five common rules on when and how we should use to enhance our web application.

posts.path: The differences between the ARIA labeling variants.md

frontmatter.title: The differences between the ARIA labeling variants
frontmatter.excerpt: I’m going to take the time to explain the differences between `aria-label`, `aria-labelledby` and `aria-describedby`. How they're used and what their use cases are.

posts.path: How to have an accessible input while the label is invisible.md

frontmatter.title: An accessible input without a visible label
frontmatter.excerpt: Let's take the time to cover a common UI pattern, that you’ll find on almost every website. An input field with no visual label. Only a placeholder. I'll explain what's missing and flawed with this approach.

posts.path: The what, why and how behind labels.md

frontmatter.title: The what, why and how behind labels
frontmatter.excerpt: Let's go over the importance of labels, and what they'll do for us, once we've added them. I'll also cover which approach is recommended to have the most support for assistive technologies.
